howItWorks.subtitle: Concentrated platelets release growth factors that drive repair.
howItWorks.title: Why PRP Helps Joints & Tendons
howItWorks.content: PRP delivers a dense mix of growth factors that modulate inflammation, promote angiogenesis, and support collagen synthesis. In joints and tendons, this can translate to reduced pain, improved biomechanics, and faster recovery when paired with rehab.

benefits.title: Drug-free biologic
benefits.description: Uses your own blood—no corticosteroid side effects.

benefits.title: Sustained relief
benefits.description: Studies show benefits lasting beyond HA and steroid in many cohorts.

benefits.title: Versatile application
benefits.description: Protocols exist for knees, hips, and chronic tendinopathies.

longDescription: Systematic reviews and multiple randomized controlled trials show PRP improves pain and function in knee osteoarthritis more durably than hyaluronic acid or corticosteroid. Trials also support PRP in hip OA and specific tendinopathies, with multi-injection protocols outperforming single doses in some studies.
tagline: Platelet-rich plasma for osteoarthritis and tendon pain

features.title: Superior to HA in RCTs
features.description: Several trials report higher WOMAC and VAS improvements vs hyaluronic acid at 6–12 months.
Studies show repeated PRP injections outperform single-dose and HA in early OA.
features.title: Multi-injection advantage
Safety profile
features.description: Autologous product with mainly transient soreness/swelling reported.

title: Scientific Evidence for PRP Joint Treatment

overview.content: Randomized trials comparing PRP with hyaluronic acid or corticosteroid demonstrate better and longer-lasting improvements in pain and function for mild-to-moderate knee OA. Additional studies support PRP for hip OA and chronic tendinopathies when delivered under ultrasound guidance.
